security_audit.summary: This is a legitimate debugging assistant skill. The static analyzer flagged 408 findings, but nearly all are false positives from documentation patterns (markdown backticks mistaken for shell execution) and JSON schema property names (mistaken for cryptographic algorithms). The shell script uses standard development commands (git, npx) for local debugging session management with no malicious network activity or credential exfiltration.

low_findings.title: claude-flow Package Dependency
low_findings.description: Shell script executes npx claude-flow commands which require the claude-flow package to be installed for full functionality

content.value_statement: Finding bugs in complex codebases wastes valuable development time. This skill provides a structured 5-phase debugging workflow that identifies root causes and validates fixes automatically.
actual_capabilities: Executes systematic 5-phase debugging workflow from symptom to prevention
Performs root cause analysis using binary search and data flow tracing
Generates multiple fix approaches with trade-off evaluation
Validates fixes through automated test execution
Stores debugging session state for resume and reporting
Integrates with git for change history analysis
limitations: Requires claude-flow package to be installed for full functionality
Depends on project having testable code structure
Cannot debug hardware or network infrastructure issues
Performance profiling requires additional tooling configuration

use_cases.title: Fix runtime errors systematically
use_cases.description: When you encounter TypeError or undefined errors, use this skill to trace the execution path and identify the exact cause.

use_cases.title: Investigate intermittent test failures
use_cases.description: Analyze race conditions and timing-dependent bugs that cause tests to fail randomly using the root cause analysis phase.

use_cases.title: Reduce bug recurrence in codebase
use_cases.description: Use the regression prevention phase to add permanent test coverage and documentation that prevents bugs from returning.

prompt_templates.title: Simple Bug Report
prompt_templates.scenario: Report a basic error you encountered
prompt_templates.prompt: /debug-assist "Users getting undefined error when clicking submit button"

prompt_templates.title: File-Specific Debug
prompt_templates.scenario: Debug an error in a known file
prompt_templates.prompt: /debug-assist --file src/auth.js "Cannot read property name of undefined at login"

prompt_templates.title: Log Analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: /debug-assist --log error.log "Server crashes randomly under high load"

output_examples.input: Shopping cart items randomly disappear for some users
output: Classification: Race condition, intermittent frequency, high severity
Root Cause: Concurrent cart updates without synchronization causing lost updates
Fix Applied: Implemented optimistic locking with version checking

best_practices: Always provide exact error messages and stack traces for faster root cause identification
Let the skill complete all 5 phases before applying fixes to ensure proper validation
Use the interactive mode for complex bugs that require iterative investigation
anti_patterns: Skipping the validation phase to save time often leads to incomplete fixes
Providing vague descriptions like fix my code instead of specific error details
Ignoring the regression prevention phase allows the same bugs to return later

faq.question: What types of bugs can this skill help with?
faq.answer: This skill handles runtime errors, null pointer exceptions, race conditions, memory leaks, async issues, and performance problems in most programming languages.

faq.question: Does this skill modify my code automatically?
faq.answer: The skill generates fixes and presents them for review. You control whether to apply the suggested changes to your codebase.

faq.question: How long does the debugging process take?
faq.answer: Most bugs are resolved within 15-45 minutes. Complex distributed system issues may take longer depending on reproduction difficulty.

faq.question: What if the skill cannot identify the root cause?
faq.answer: The skill will escalate complex issues with a detailed analysis report and recommendations for manual investigation or architectural review.

faq.question: Can I resume a debugging session later?
faq.answer: Yes. Session state is stored in memory. Use the --status flag to check progress and --report to generate a summary of findings.

faq.question: Does this work with any programming language?
faq.answer: Yes. The debugging methodology is language-agnostic. Test execution commands can be configured in .debug-config.json for your project.
